report_text: FINDINGS: The heart is normal in size. The mediastinum is unremarkable. The lungs are clear. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. IMPRESSION: No acute cardiopulmonary process.
FINDINGS: There is an opacity in the right lower lobe, consistent with pneumonia. Mild cardiomegaly is noted. The pleural spaces are clear. No pneumothorax. IMPRESSION: Right lower lobe pneumonia.

FINDINGS: Bilateral interstitial opacities are seen, suggestive of pulmonary edema. Small bilateral pleural effusions are present. The cardiac silhouette is enlarged. Support devices are in place. IMPRESSION: Findings consistent with congestive heart failure and pulmonary edema.
